Improvements.Improvement: Refactor long and repetitive if-else conditions to a switch statement
Improvements.Description: The if-else conditions checking for the URL endings can be refactored into a switch statement. This will make the code more readable, maintainable, and potentially improve performance as the switch statement in Java is generally faster than if-else conditions.

Improvements.Improvement: Extract common assertions into a separate method
Improvements.Description: Common assertions such as 'assertTrue(path.getGet().getTags().contains(...))' and 'assertNull(path.getPost());' are repeated several times in the code. These can be extracted into a separate method to reduce code repetition and improve readability.
